moves.1. f4: the Birds' opening: or as I like to call it, the Dutch opening (1. d4 f5) advanced; always an adventure...
moves.1... d5: the only feasable move: we are playing d4, f5, but reversed...
moves.2. Nf3 c5 3. e3: not my style, but still part of this spectrum: I prefer the fianchetto g3, Bg2...
moves.5... Bb7 6. Bg2 d4 7. Ne2: exd4, does not look good: this is only slightly better...
moves.9. Qb3: before things really get out of hand...
moves.9... Qd5: Black wants to trade at own terms: I looked at c5-c4, but controlling d4 is a big issue here...
moves.15... f6 16. Ng4 h5 17. Nf2: of course, Black is way behind in development: but there is profit in the momentum of this attack...
the Black defense is holding: White needs more material to participate, but it might already be too late..
moves.24. Na4 Nd7 25. Nac5 Nxc5 26. Nxc5 Nf6 2: White is getting no grip, on the Black position...
moves.28. e4 Rag8: time to push things a bit...
moves.29. Rf3: practically the only defense: Nxa6 could make a lot of difference...
moves.38... d1=Q 39. Rxe6+ Kf7: needless to say, White had to resign...
